DOCNAME: CASE OF GERASIYEV AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 2;Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 5;Violation of Art. 13+2;No violation of Art. 3

CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals and residents of the village of PERSON , GPE .
CARDINAL . The first applicant is the father and the second applicant is the mother of PERSON , born in DATE . The third and fourth applicants are , respectively , brother and sister of PERSON .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants and PERSON resided in their privately owned house in the village of PERSON . After the launch of the counter - terrorist operation in GPE , the first applicant and some of his relatives moved to ORG . PERSON , the first applicant ’s other son and the fourth applicant stayed in PERSON to look after the family house .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE federal forces regained control over PERSON . The hostilities ceased and the civil population began to return to the area . PERSON , the fourth applicant and their brother decided to stay in PERSON and not to move to ORG as they had previously planned .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the PERSON family ran out of firewood to heat their house . There being no forest area in the vicinity of PERSON , Valid PERSON went to the neighbouring village of ORG where GPE , a relative of the GPE , resided and where he could obtain firewood .

CARDINAL . On DATE Valid Gerasiyev and ORG went to the forest to collect firewood in the latter ’s tractor . At a certain moment the tractor started skidding and ORG had to return to the village to fetch a rope . When he returned to the forest on his bike and found PERSON , both men came under fire . They decided to leave the area and abandon the vehicles . While they were trying to leave , a shell hit the tractor and the bike . PERSON was hit by a shell splinter in the back of his arm . The wound did not seem particularly serious but his arm was bleeding .

CARDINAL . Later on the same day Valid PERSON and PERSON returned to ORG . The village was also under fire and the residents tried to shelter from the bombing . The men learnt from the local residents that federal forces were bombing the village because a group of rebels had passed through it earlier . Those rebels had been previously forced out of ORG by federal forces .

CARDINAL . Having arrived at ORG ’s house , PERSON and PERSON went to the basement to shelter from the bombing . Later on DATE about CARDINAL residents of the village joined them in the basement , among them GPE , GPE and LOC . PERSON They bandaged Valid PERSON ’s arm because the wound was still bleeding .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bombing continued and the people stayed in the basement .

CARDINAL . On DATE federal forces started a “ sweeping ” operation in ORG . The servicemen ordered everyone to come out of ORG basement and checked their identity documents . They immediately spotted PERSON bandaged arm and asked him how he had been wounded . He did not speak NORP and could not answer the question . When ORG and others tried to explain that he had been wounded while collecting firewood , the servicemen threatened them with their submachine guns and ordered them to remain silent .

CARDINAL . At the same time the servicemen brought people out of the neighbouring houses and checked their identities . It turned out that General LOC was in command of the federal forces’ operation in LOC and that he was present during the identity checks . A certain FAC , a police officer from the neighbouring village ORG , tried to stand up for PERSON and the other young men targeted by the servicemen . He addressed General PERSON and asked him why federal forces had remained passive while the rebels had been passing through the village and why were they now trying to find fault with peaceful village residents . According to the written statement by PERSON . PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , in response General PERSON allegedly ordered the servicemen to disarm GPE and to beat him up , which they immediately did .

CARDINAL . The servicemen then put PERSON in a ORG minibus which was specifically re - equipped for transporting detained persons and drove away . Residents of the village alleged to have subsequently seen the minibus in the courtyard of ORG military commander ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the servicemen took CARDINAL other residents of ORG away . On an unspecified date in DATE the body of QUANTITY of them , PERSON . NORP , was found in the river on the outskirts of the village . The other missing persons were not found .
CARDINAL . The applicants have had no news of Valid PERSON since .

CARDINAL . The account of the events described above is based on the information contained in the application form ; a written statement made by the first applicant on DATE ; written statements by GPE and GPE dated DATE ; a written statement by DATE , and a written statement by ORG . PERSON made on DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , no evidence that Valid PERSON had been abducted by servicemen during a special operation was uncovered during the domestic investigation .

CARDINAL . It appears that the applicants returned to LOC around DATE . Having learnt about the abduction of PERSON at about that time , the applicants applied , orally and in writing , to various lawenforcement authorities , seeking information on his whereabouts . Although the first applicant was almost illiterate ( he never went to school ) , he made most of the enquiries in connection with the disappearance of his son , also on behalf of other applicants . At certain points he asked his neighbours for assistance in compiling his complaints . In the applicants’ submission , given the limited level of the first applicant ’s education , he did not keep copies of all his complaints to the authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained about the disappearance of PERSON to ORG of the Interior ( “ the NORP ” ) .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the NORP prosecutor ’s office ” ) forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint about the disappearance of his son , along with CARDINAL similar complaints by other persons from GPE , to the head of ORG and instructed him to notify the complainants about the decisions taken .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG replied to the first applicant that PERSON had not been detained on the LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE ( or DATE the copy of the relevant letter is partly illegible ) the NORP prosecutor ’s office forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint about the disappearance of PERSON to the acting prosecutor of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed another complaint about the disappearance of Valid PERSON with the PERSON . It appears that the NORP carried out an inquiry which resulted in a decision of DATE refusing to open a criminal case into the disappearance of the first applicant ’s missing son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of LOC ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) set aside the decision of DATE and launched a criminal investigation into the disappearance of PERSON under LAW ( aggravated unlawful deprivation of liberty ) . The case file was assigned no . DATE . The investigator ’s decision referred , among other things , to a written statement by ORG to the effect that on DATE about CARDINAL officials of the military commander ’s office of the village of ORG had come to ORG ’s home and had taken away PERSON , and also to the fact that since that time the latter had been missing . It appears that the applicants were notified about that decision .

CARDINAL . According to the applicants , after the initiation of the investigation on DATE , they were convinced that the district prosecutor ’s office would search for PERSON and find his abductors . Consequently , for DATE they waited for that body to fulfil its duties . Moreover , each time they enquired , mostly orally , about the progress of the investigation , the officials of the district prosecutor ’s office reassured them that the investigation was under way . It was only in DATE that the first applicant sought professional legal advice in connection with the disappearance of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested the district prosecutor ’s office to provide him with information on the progress of the investigation into the disappearance of his son and to grant him victim status in connection with those proceedings . It does not appear that his request was ever replied to .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed another complaint with the district prosecutor ’s office , claiming that the investigation into the disappearance of his son had been slow and that he had not had any information on its progress . He requested to be provided with access to the investigation case file and the proceedings to be resumed in the event that they had been suspended .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office notified the first applicant that it had granted his request in so far as it concerned the resumption of the investigation and had dismissed the remainder of the complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office resumed the investigation in case no . CARDINAL . The decision , in so far as relevant , stated as follows :

“ ... In the present case on DATE [ the district prosecutor ’s office ] initiated a criminal investigation under LAW in connection with the fact that on DATE , during a special operation carried out by federal security forces in the village of ORG , in LOC , a group of unidentified persons in camouflage uniforms , who arrived in a grey PERSON minibus , arrested and took away to an unknown destination PERSON , [ born in ] DATE , resident of the village of PERSON , who was , at the moment of his abduction , at no CARDINAL FAC , the home of [ GPE ] , resident of ORG . The whereabouts of PERSON remain unknown .
On DATE , upon the expiry of the time - limit for the preliminary investigation , the proceedings [ in case no . CARDINAL ] were adjourned .
The decision to suspend the investigation was unfounded and premature and should be set aside as it was issued on the basis of insufficiently verified information about the crime .

The examination [ of the case file ] reveals that not all comprehensive measures aimed at establishing the truth were carried out ; the investigation was incomplete ... In particular , in order to elucidate the circumstances of the crime [ the investigators ] should question the residents of the village of LOC , relatives , neighbours and acquaintances of the missing person , as well as persons from ORG residing in the immediate vicinity of the crime scene . Not all measures necessary to identify other witnesses , eyewitnesses to the crime or the culprits were taken . Furthermore , the investigators did not verify information pertaining to the ownership of the ORG vehicle used by the perpetrators ; a close relative of the missing person was neither questioned nor granted victim status .

An additional investigation should broaden the circle of potential witnesses to the crime , instruct the police to take additional operational and search measures aimed at establishing the whereabouts of the missing person and identifying the perpetrators , to examine all the relevant circumstances of the crime ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was granted victim status in connection with the proceedings in case no . DATE . He was notified about that decision on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained to ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) about the refusal of the district prosecutor ’s office to provide him with access to case file no . DATE ( see below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation in case no . DATE owing to the failure to identify those responsible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant formally joined the proceedings in case no . DATE as a civil party . He claimed MONEY ( RUB ) in respect of pecuniary and nonpecuniary damage caused by the offence .

CARDINAL . Despite the ORG ’s specific requests , the ORG refused to submit a copy of the entire criminal case file opened into the abduction of the applicants’ relative . They did not put forward any explanation for their failure to do so . The ORG furnished only copies of several ORG statements , the decisions to open and resume the investigation and the ORG requests to various authorities concerning the whereabouts of PERSON , as well as some of the replies to them . Some of the documents provided by the Government were illegible ; others were legible only in part . The information contained in those documents , in so far as they are legible , is summarised below .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the investigators interviewed ORG , residing at CARDINAL , PERSON street , ORG , as a witness .
